emuInput.TitMainTitle: Six male pallbearers wearing dark suits, light colored gloves, and light colored Masonic aprons, carrying one of two patterned caskets down steps of Metropolitan Baptist Church for funeral of Ralph Creighton and Arlene Creighton, another version
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. 1 reads: "Double Funeral for Carbon Monoxide Victims - Distraught Beverly, 15, front, and Joanna Creighton, 13, rear, in left photo, who came home from Conroy School Friday afternoon to find their parents, Ralph, 35, and Arlene, 34, dead from carbon monoxide fumes, leaves the Metropolitan Baptist Church, following the double funeral services Tuesday. Center photo shows Mr. Creighton's mother, Mrs. Luella Creighton, of Charles St., leaving the church.  Right photo shows the two caskets being carried from the church."
